summary: "Labyrinth" is a 1986 fantasy movie directed by Jim Henson, with George Lucas as a producer. The film stars Jennifer Connelly as Sarah and David Bowie as Jareth, the Goblin King. Sarah must navigate a huge maze to rescue her baby brother Toby, whom she wished away to Jareth. The film was inspired by Brian Froud's designs and Terry Jones wrote the script. Though it didn't do well in the US, it was popular in the UK and worldwide. Initially receiving mixed reviews, "Labyrinth" has since gained a large cult following and has been adapted into various media, including books, games, and comics.
title: Labyrinth (1986 film)
